channel.title: Projects on Enactivity
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Enactivity

item.title: Law to XML
item.description: The current flow and format The Parliamentary Counsel’s Office writes New Zealand enactments, using software tools which generate XML files. Those files are packed with detailed metadata to help with print layouts. But that extra data can get in the way of open-source, automated, and collaborative approaches to working with legislation.

item.title: XML to open law on GitHub
item.description: Tracking changes online GitHub is a tool for sharing text. Most of that text is code, but it can also work for sharing legislation. It is a familiar tool for programmers, making it easy to track changes to code over time, and to talk about what changes make sense. Those are natural advantages for legislation as well.
